greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 1; a(n+1) = sum{k|n} a(k) * mu(k), where the sum is over the positive divisors, k, of n; and mu(k) is the Moebius function.
comment: Conjecture: all integers are present. - _W. Edwin Clark_, Aug 20 2004
a(A227953(n)) = n and a(A227954(n)) = -n. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 01 2013
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: a(7) = a(1) mu(1) + a(2) mu(2) + a(3) mu(3) + a(6) mu(6) = 1 - 1 - 0 + 1 = 1 because 1, 2, 3 and 6 are the divisors of 6.
maple: a:=proc(n) option remember; add(numtheory[mobius](i)*a(i),i in numtheory[divisors](n-1)) end: a(1):=1: seq(a(n),n=1..100); # Alec Mihailovs, Aug 20 2004
mathematica: a[1] = a[2] = 1; a[n_] := a[n] = Block[{d = Divisors[n - 1]}, Plus @@ (MoebiusMu[d]*a /@ d)]; Table[ a[n], {n, 105}] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 21 2004 *)
program: y = sum $ zipWith (*) (map a070965 $ a027750_row x) (a225817_row x)
results.author: _Leroy Quet_, May 16 2002
